newsitem.title: USA: US OPTIONS FOCUS/IBM busy as stock holds ground.
newsitem.headline: US OPTIONS FOCUS/IBM busy as stock holds ground.

text.p: Options on shares of International Business Machines Corp were busy Tuesday as the stock struggled to hold firm in the face of a sharp market selloff.
In afternoon trading, as the bellwether Dow industrial average .DJI was down 77 points at 7,681, IBM was up 1/4 at 92-1/16.
The stock, which had rallied to a new year high at 93-3/4, traded more than 4.5 million shares.
"IBM was strong again in the morning and only grudgingly giving up ground," said Jon Najarian, president of Mercury Trading, the designated primary market maker in IBM options.
Most of the action in IBM options was in the July series, but the January 1998 95 call traded a heavy 3,890 contracts.
"Somebody's placing a big bet," Najarian said, adding that most of those calls traded when the stock was at its highs for the day.
Among the other options, the July 90 calls traded more than 5,600 contracts, the July 95 calls traded nearly 4,400 and the July 90 puts traded 3,490.
Options on another technology stock, Micron Technology Inc, also were active as that stock rallied in the face of the broader selloff.
Micron shares gained 1-9/16 to 42-1/2 on more than 10 million shares.
Earlier, Merrill Lynch said it reiterated Micron as an intermediate and long term buy.
Most of the Micron options activity crossed at the Pacific Exchange. The options trade both there and at the Chicago Board Options exchange.
Activity in Micron options was highlighted by the July 45 calls, which traded a total of about 8,520 contracts.
The July 50 calls traded 3,635 and the July 42-1/2 calls traded 3,765.
Among Micron puts, the July 42-1/2 traded around 1,620 contracts and the 37-1/2 37-1/2 traded 1,420.
